Text.text: My grandmother bought me this camera to peruse my love for photography.
So all in all I’m a beginner with the professional camera world.
I’ve had this camer for a little over a year now and can truly say it is a must buy.
great camera
Love my camera.
Easy to use and creates great quality pictures.
This is a super camera.
Easy to use.

Great for a beginner.
Really great product just as advertised.

Takes great pictures.
Great camera good price for it for sure !
wrks spectacular
Great camera, great price!

Review.author: KRGraphics
Review.title: The best (early) birthday gift I've ever got!!

Text.text: I have been doing a lot of work with 3D scanning and Photogrammetry and using an older Nikon L100 point and shoot wasn't cutting the mustard for me.
For instance, on a Point and Shoot, you can't control the shutter speed easily or the ISO or the final output.

After extensive research on DSLR cameras (this and the Canon T6i Rebel), I ended up getting this camera (not choosing the D3400 which was 100 dollars more, and not choosing the T6i because it was out of my pricing range at the time) on impulse, because it was on sale and I needed a better camera for reality capture (I use Agisoft Photoscan for Photogrammetry).

After taking a few pictures using all of the modes, the visual quality of my images is a HUGE jump, especially from using cameras on the smartphone and the COOLPIX L100 that would never afford me this level of detail.

Review.author: Isaac Dennis
Review.title: If you are a beginner than this camera is for you!!!

Text.text: I love this camera and it's a great camera to start off with.
Photography is about your style and the Nikon d3300 definitely helps you find it!!!
I myself am ready for the next step in photography and videography, but only thanks to this camera!
All the following photos where taken with the Nikon d3300 w/ 18-55 AF-S lens (stock everything)
Great little camera.
I'm a beginner and I can see it's simple enough to point and shoot, but has enough options that it'll keep me busy learning for quite a while!
Can't wait to get additional lenses and flash for it.
Decent price.
Delivered in good shape and on time.
After being into photography in my earlier years (this was before digital cameras were a thing), I decided to get back into.
I decided on the D3300 as it wasn't terribly expensive got good reviews for being a very good beginner's DSLR.

I actually chose the D3300 over the newer D3400 and Canon Rebel T6 as it had a microphone jack, which could be important going forward, a better flash, which can be helpful, and electronic sensor cleaner which probably isn't a big deal.
The Canon had an older sensor and worse continuous shooting speed ( I moonlight as a pro-wrestling photographer on occasion).
I'm very pleased with the camera, it's lived up to all my expectations.
Sometimes I do wish I had spent the extra money for the D5300 or Canon Rebel SL2 for their movable LCD screens , but for my needs as hobbyist, the D3300 is great.
Battery life is better than the specs suggest.
I'm able to shoot well over 600 shots (without the flash) and the battery still is over half charge.
great camera.
easy to use
It did not come with the lens as in website picture.
This camera has one fatal limitation if you are planning to use it for recording long videos.
It has a hard limit of 30 minutes, then just stops.
You can restart the recording manually, but there will be a gap.
So it is not suitable for typical class lectures of 1 hour or more.
This limitation is hard to find in the specs.
Buyer beware!
This is a great camera.
I use this camera daily to record videos for school.
It takes great quality pictures and videos.
It is not hard to use.

The directions are easy to understand.
I'm excited to start using it.
Fantastic camera.

Review.author: CCMacC
Review.title: Excellent camera. Lightweight and easy to navigate

Text.text: We got this at the wrong time of year.
It was meant to go on a trip with us and we didn't order it soon enough before we left
Love this camera!
Great features and takes awesome photos.
I know it's more entry level as far as Nikon goes but it really does take great shots.

This is my first DSLR and with that being said as long as you take the time to understand fundamentally how the camera works all of its functions the terminology and what each and every setting does and how it affects your end product you will be well served by this product.

I did buy Nikons 35mm prime lens and have been using that ever since and have noticed a obvious difference in sharpness and clarity with my photos however the stock lens shoots great as well,all photos provided are shot with Nikons 35mm prime lens.
This camera is a fantastic value.
I purchased mine for two reasons:
Love it!
Great condition.
Love this camera its such a good camera.
Takes great pictures has tons of options for customization.
Has tons of features.
Good little workhorse.
Many meatures found in more expensive models have filtered down.
After a ton of research for months I went with this bad boy and so happy I did.
It's taken some practice but I'm getting there & hadn't even used photo shop or editing yet.
Looking back prolly would have went with the D3400 for the wifi to transfer to my phone but hopefully find an adapter soon.
Note: the very next day after my purchase the D3400 went on sale for the same price so keep an open eye out.
Bonus: helps to find a good lens hood too so you don't look like too much of a rookie.
Love it!
Great camera at a great price to take photos of products in my new business.

Easy to learn and takes good quality pictures.

I am satisfied with this purchase.
One of the beast entry level dslr’s money can buy

It also has great features for further clarity.
Everything as described, it has high quality photos, and plenty of features.
Definitely make sure make sure you pick up an extra battery.
This camera is FANTASTIC!!!
It is perfect for my everyday use at work.
I would recommend it to anyone!
This was a gift and it takes beautiful pictures

Review.author: AllComputing
Review.title: The D3300 takes good photos in automatic mode

Text.text: Have been using other Nikons for over 17 years.
The D3300 takes good photos in automatic mode, for the price range.
Overall, a solid product and performing as expected, thus far.
The microphone and speaker both have reasonably good quality for being built-it.
Battery lasts for a long time for photos, but will not last as long in video mode, obviously.
The camera is light and comfortably contoured to hold securely.
What a perfect camera!

Review.author: Bob Zollinger
Review.title: This is great!! Item is as described - Highly recommend

Text.text: This is great!!
Item is as described - Highly recommend.
No issues
What can I say?
This little camera is amazing!
Sure, it's not the flagship with all the bells and whistles, but this camera can hold its own, especially for a beginner.
Bought this camera for my son.
These are some of the pictures he took (before editing):
Fantastic camera!

Review.author: Jacqueline Tomkinson
Review.title: Takes great pics even if you're a beginner

Text.text: I'm a beginner photographer.
This camera has lots of bells and whistles.

I am loving it!

Review.author: Matthew Dalton
Review.title: This is a good camera. I've taken many great photos with it

Text.text: This is a good camera.
I've taken many great photos with it.

You'll get way more camera for your money and the image quality is amazing.
Use mine with Tamron 150-600mm g2

Review.author: Julius C.
Review.title: Arrived last night was working fine and then when I wake up I try to ...

Text.text: Arrived last night was working fine and then when I wake up I try to turn it on it doesn’t work.
Pretty disappointed.
I even went to the Nikon office in Los Angeles and they told me it was completely dead.
Tried other batteries too and nothing.
Still won’t turn on.
Even more disappointed that I paid the 2 day shipping just to have a faulty dslr arrive.
LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!!
Best camera EVER!
This was given to me as a gift and I adore it!
Great beginner camera :)
My wife has wanted a camera for years and finally she let me research one and buy it for her.
Based on reviews here and everywhere else I chose this camera.
We have had a ball learning about photography and using this camera.
Didn't take long to swap on over to aperture priority and create some wonderful pictures.
Have also taken the camera to a few of our sons basketball games and it does superb there as well.
We changed to shutter priority and continuous shots and were able to bring kids in motion to a standstill while maintaining wonderful clarity and quality.
We've already ordered the 55-200 lens and a bunch of filters.
I'm certain this will bring years of enjoyment.
Great purchase.
And they overnighted it to me free of charge.
Can't beat that!
A quality camera.
I got this camera about two months ago and still learning how to use it.
It has more features than purse size cameras.
Pictures taken have not been printed yet, so how its quality is remain to be seen, thus far from viewing the LCD screen, it looks nice.
love it.
Great product!
Amature photographer here.
This is my first DSLR camera and I did literally days of research.
I was on the road for work for two months and had little else to do in the hotel room at night!
After days of watching Youtube videos and reviews.
Reading comparisons between Nikon and Cannon.
Comparing various models and mirrorless cameras etc.
I just never found a bad review about this camera.
It had better reviews and a better price than its updated sister camera the 3400.
Obviously for a pro photographer this might not cut it but for someone new to the hobby this has everything you need and more.
Love my new camera.
I’m still a beginner but The Nikon D3300 is so easy to use, I’m already shooting in Manual mode.

Review.author: Danny Boyd
Review.title: Bought this set-up for my 15yr old daughter - She has loved the D3300 since the first day.

Text.text: Bought the Nikon D3300 with the 18-55mm for my 15yr old daughter.
She was just getting into photography and needed a step up from her old Canon SX50.
Over the last year she has really upped her photography game.
I don't think you can find a better entry lever DSLR for the money.
Received today, all new in the retail box.

Review.author: Richard
Review.title: Definitely would recommend to anyone interested in photography and looking to get ...

Text.text: Definitely would recommend to anyone interested in photography and looking to get their feet wet.
The Nikon D3300 has insane value and is a more than fair price for what it offers you.
Crystal clear photos along with 1080p video that I personally use to record YouTube videos.
It's a very good get and you certainly won't regret it.
I personally bought the NIKKOR 1.8G lens to accompany with it because I believe that it fits better for portraits and close-ups but to each their own.
The settings are easy to use and modify, and if you can live with the lack of in-camera wifi connectivity, then I can promise you it's certainly a quality camera to help get you started.

Review.author: 92sub
Review.title: Small, light but seems to pack a punch.

Text.text: Only have a hundred shots thru it yet but so far it's great.
Much smaller and lighter than my old D7000.
The new 'P' lens is really fast and silent.
Will update review after some real time with it.
Purchased for our son's birthday and he loves it!
Very nice.
She's also tried more expensive cameras, prefers this one.
I'm not a camera guy but she really likes it
You can film a turd in your toilet, slap 'Directed by Steven Spielberg' on it and people will see it in theaters.
The footage from this camera looks better than real life somehow and it's very affordable.

Review.author: kevrock1
Review.title: I would recommend a series of Nikon

Text.text: I would have wrote five stars but I was absolutely in love with the D 3200 from Nikon this camera is very effective and has very nice features links to my iPhone very easily and pictures are accessible within seconds don’t get me wrong this is a top-of-the-line camera I highly recommend it the picture quality is great I just expected it to be leaps and bounds better than the D 3200 which is not the case.
I'm pretty much exclusively self taught so I don't know much about the lingo, but I do know what to mess with to get the results I want.
My dad got me this camera as a gift and it has proved to be a very impressive travel partner and has gone with me to different countries and states, producing many great pictures.
This camera has helped me get a better feel for knowing what settings to use and when to use them and I've absolutely love the results it's given me for the price.
If you're looking for a camera to get started with or just want a more versatile camera to use on the go- this is a great choice.

I loved having the ability to use the wifi and quickly transfer pictures from my camera to my phone which made being the 'photographer friend' at parties a breeze because I could quickly air drop the pics to my friends without having to worry about uploading them to a computer and then to my phone while losing picture quality in the process.

It works really well in low-light situations like I have pictured, my friends and I were on a roof in Mexico and others were having trouble getting good pictures with the fading light but this camera adapted really well and my pictures still came out focused despite barely being able to see my own hands.

I'm going to upgrade to a Nikon D7200 but will definitely keep this exceptional camera as a back up, just figured I'd leave a good review for people looking to get started with photography and those looking to continue their learning :)
I bought this for my adult daughter.
I have a D750 Nikon, so we are able to share lenses also.
She absolutely loves this camera, and the quality of the images, from dark sky star shots, to landscape and portraits is phenomenal!

Text.text: This nikon is easy to use and provides fine results.
Very happy.
Easy to use.
Clear photos, love it.
I've never really owned a professional camera as this.
To me, this is perfect for capturing moments with a vivid picture quality.
For the most part it is easy to use.
Just one minor problem I've had is where the flash doesn't come on when I want it to even when the flash option is on, and this happened only about 4 times so I'm not too concerned.
Overall, loving it!
Easy to use and the battery life is great!
Takes really good pictures!
Great for a new photographer.
Really easy for beginners and professionals highly recommend

Review.author: Caleb
Review.title: and I love it. Every new lens I buy opens new ...

Text.text: I've had one of these for a year, and I love it.

Review.author: Robert F. Gardner
Review.title: Almost Perfect entry-level camera, get it, seriously get it...

Text.text: I love this camera!
I think it is fantastic.
If you want a great entry level camera that takes EXCELLENT images you need this camera.
It is small and light.
It is really good in low light.
Images at 6400 ISO are usable for most things.
I personally believe 24 mp is a sweet spot.
The files are not huge, and they load fairly fast in Lightroom.
Plus you can crop images and they will look fantastic.
lSeriously, if you are into taking great images and you want to start with a DSLR, you need this Nikon D3300 to begin your journey
